It's failing because it tries to install ign-math2 and 3 at the same time:

http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopFail/job/gazebo-ci-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/211/console

With this PR, it's installing only ign-math3 and the build has already passed beyond the point where the link above failed:

values.description:
[sdformat-ci-default-trusty-amd64 #47](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopTests/job/sdformat-ci-default-trusty-amd64/47) failed because it attempted to install packages with out of date package lists. (see #100)

This PR squashes `apt-get update` into the same layer as `apt-get install`. I also squashed the `echo` statments that are being used to invalidate the cache, and added `apt-get clean` to remove the downloaded .deb files to reduce the layer size.

This branch passed testing of [sdformat-ci-default-trusty-amd64 #48](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopTests/job/sdformat-ci-default-trusty-amd64/48/console)
values.title: Squashed layers, packages are installed with current package lists

summary.raw:
[sdformat-ci-default-trusty-amd64 #47](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopTests/job/sdformat-ci-default-trusty-amd64/47) failed because it attempted to install packages with out of date package lists. (see #100)

This PR squashes `apt-get update` into the same layer as `apt-get install`. I also squashed the `echo` statments that are being used to invalidate the cache, and added `apt-get clean` to remove the downloaded .deb files to reduce the layer size.

This branch passed testing of [sdformat-ci-default-trusty-amd64 #48](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopTests/job/sdformat-ci-default-trusty-amd64/48/console)
summary.html:
sdformat-ci-default-trusty-amd64 #47 failed because it attempted to install packages with out of date package lists. (see #100)

This PR squashes apt-get update into the same layer as apt-get install. I also squashed the echo statments that are being used to invalidate the cache, and added apt-get clean to remove the downloaded .deb files to reduce the layer size.

This branch passed testing of sdformat-ci-default-trusty-amd64 #48

values.description:
This PR implement the generation of different builder jobs, one per each supported osX distribution.

The split of the file made difficult to track changes, I created a temporary branch for this and the reference is commit 4809e31.

Note that using different copyArtifacts steps is valid and the parameter optional is on by default, so the `bottle_hash_updater_job_name` should be able to handle calls from the different jobs without failing if it does not find artifacts in one of them.

Still pending of testing since it will impact in the current infrastructure.
values.title: Implement multi-distribution bottle creation

summary.raw:
This PR implement the generation of different builder jobs, one per each supported osX distribution.

The split of the file made difficult to track changes, I created a temporary branch for this and the reference is commit 4809e31.

Note that using different copyArtifacts steps is valid and the parameter optional is on by default, so the `bottle_hash_updater_job_name` should be able to handle calls from the different jobs without failing if it does not find artifacts in one of them.

Still pending of testing since it will impact in the current infrastructure.
summary.html:
This PR implement the generation of different builder jobs, one per each supported osX distribution.

The split of the file made difficult to track changes, I created a temporary branch for this and the reference is commit 4809e31.

Note that using different copyArtifacts steps is valid and the parameter optional is on by default, so the bottle_hash_updater_job_name should be able to handle calls from the different jobs without failing if it does not find artifacts in one of them.

Still pending of testing since it will impact in the current infrastructure.

values.description:
Create a new CI job to be integrated into the `gazebo_ros_pkgs` that allows to test in a change in the `gazebo_ros_pkgs` software can break third party software relying on it. The motivation came from [this failure in the Kinetic sync](https://discourse.ros.org/t/need-to-sync-new-release-of-rqt-topic-indigo-jade-kinetic/1410/2?u=jrivero).

I've chosen hector_gazebo but we it is up to include more packages or replace it by a package which fits better the testing.

Testing:

  * [Broken commit (same commit that broke the kinetic sync)](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-ci-pr_regression_any-xenial-amd64/12/)
  * [Current kinetic branch](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-ci-pr_regression_any-xenial-amd64/16)
values.title: Integrate the build of consumers of gazebo_ros_pkgs into the CI

@tfoote just FYI, it could be useful for you if I'm not around

values.description:
This PR implements a one-liner installation for the SRCSim project. The intend is to be able to call the whole installation + some of the configurations steps by invoking `curl -sSL https://get.srcsim.gazebosim.org | sh`.

The functionality can be manually triggered by run: `sh release-toosl/one-line-installations/srcsim.sh`

The PR also implements the creation of the test job. Currently the testing job is able to install all the requirements (note that the runtime testing could be failing):

 * http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/srcsim-install-one_liner-trusty-amd64/13/console#console-section-6

This PR in combination with the [SRCSim setup.bash file](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/srcsim/pull-requests/40/create-a-helper-setupbash-system-file/diff) should reduce the SRCSim setup to just: 1. run one-liner 2. source setup.bash 3. use the launch files.
values.title: SRCSim one-liner installation script

summary.raw:
This PR implements a one-liner installation for the SRCSim project. The intend is to be able to call the whole installation + some of the configurations steps by invoking `curl -sSL https://get.srcsim.gazebosim.org | sh`.

The functionality can be manually triggered by run: `sh release-toosl/one-line-installations/srcsim.sh`

The PR also implements the creation of the test job. Currently the testing job is able to install all the requirements (note that the runtime testing could be failing):

 * http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/srcsim-install-one_liner-trusty-amd64/13/console#console-section-6

This PR in combination with the [SRCSim setup.bash file](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/srcsim/pull-requests/40/create-a-helper-setupbash-system-file/diff) should reduce the SRCSim setup to just: 1. run one-liner 2. source setup.bash 3. use the launch files.
summary.html:
This PR implements a one-liner installation for the SRCSim project. The intend is to be able to call the whole installation + some of the configurations steps by invoking curl -sSL https://get.srcsim.gazebosim.org | sh.

The functionality can be manually triggered by run: sh release-toosl/one-line-installations/srcsim.sh

The PR also implements the creation of the test job. Currently the testing job is able to install all the requirements (note that the runtime testing could be failing):

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/srcsim-install-one_liner-trusty-amd64/13/console#console-section-6

This PR in combination with the SRCSim setup.bash file should reduce the SRCSim setup to just: 1. run one-liner 2. source setup.bash 3. use the launch files.

values.description:
The Ign-transport Windows job is [broken](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopFail/job/ignition_transport-ci-default-windows7-amd64/90/).

Ignition Transport depends on Ignition Msgs. We're cloning Ignition Msgs from default. Ignition Msgs "default" depends on "Ignition Math 3.x" but we are cloning Ignition Math "default", which is already in version 4.x. I believe this is the reason for not finding Ignition Math 3.
values.title: Fix ign-transport Windows job

summary.raw:
The Ign-transport Windows job is [broken](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopFail/job/ignition_transport-ci-default-windows7-amd64/90/).

Ignition Transport depends on Ignition Msgs. We're cloning Ignition Msgs from default. Ignition Msgs "default" depends on "Ignition Math 3.x" but we are cloning Ignition Math "default", which is already in version 4.x. I believe this is the reason for not finding Ignition Math 3.
summary.html:
The Ign-transport Windows job is broken.

Ignition Transport depends on Ignition Msgs. We're cloning Ignition Msgs from default. Ignition Msgs "default" depends on "Ignition Math 3.x" but we are cloning Ignition Math "default", which is already in version 4.x. I believe this is the reason for not finding Ignition Math 3.

values.description:
New features:

 * Daily testing of all versions of gazebo_ros_pkgs (official ROS and unofficial in osrf pkg repo)
 * Support for gazebo8 on ROS Kinetic

The daily test has been tested here: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/12/

The ci-pr_any has been tested here: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-ci-pr_any_kinetic-xenial-amd64/1/

summary.raw:
New features:

 * Daily testing of all versions of gazebo_ros_pkgs (official ROS and unofficial in osrf pkg repo)
 * Support for gazebo8 on ROS Kinetic

The daily test has been tested here: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/12/

summary.html:
New features:

  • Daily testing of all versions of gazebo_ros_pkgs (official ROS and unofficial in osrf pkg repo)
  • Support for gazebo8 on ROS Kinetic

The daily test has been tested here: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-install_pkg_kinetic-xenial-amd64/12/

The ci-pr_any has been tested here: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo_pkgs-ci-pr_any_kinetic-xenial-amd64/1/

values.description:
The `gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64` build failed recently. It didn't actually install the package during the install step, then failed during the test step.

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64/473/

Running `brew audit` helps reveal the cause:

~~~
 ~/osrf/release-tools
$ brew audit gazebo8
osrf/simulation/gazebo8:
  * Dependency 'qt5' was renamed; use new name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' is an alias; use the canonical name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' was renamed; use new name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' is an alias; use the canonical name 'qt'.
~~~

We can fix the problem with a new gazebo bottle. In the meantime, I'd like to add a `brew audit` step to the one-line installer to help provide better debugging information in the future.
values.title: audit brew formula in one-line installation script to help diagnose problems

summary.raw:
The `gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64` build failed recently. It didn't actually install the package during the install step, then failed during the test step.

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64/473/

Running `brew audit` helps reveal the cause:

~~~
 ~/osrf/release-tools
$ brew audit gazebo8
osrf/simulation/gazebo8:
  * Dependency 'qt5' was renamed; use new name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' is an alias; use the canonical name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' was renamed; use new name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' is an alias; use the canonical name 'qt'.
~~~

We can fix the problem with a new gazebo bottle. In the meantime, I'd like to add a `brew audit` step to the one-line installer to help provide better debugging information in the future.
summary.html:
The gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64 build failed recently. It didn't actually install the package during the install step, then failed during the test step.

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64/473/

Running brew audit helps reveal the cause:

 ~/osrf/release-tools
$ brew audit gazebo8
osrf/simulation/gazebo8:
  * Dependency 'qt5' was renamed; use new name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' is an alias; use the canonical name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' was renamed; use new name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' is an alias; use the canonical name 'qt'.

We can fix the problem with a new gazebo bottle. In the meantime, I'd like to add a brew audit step to the one-line installer to help provide better debugging information in the future.

values.description:
Implement the release of packages for Debian include a `debian/` directory inside the -release repositories. By now, release.py won't generate Debian packages by default.

Tested here: http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ign-math3-debbuilder/44/
values.title: Support to release packages for debian in debbuild
